message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.MM

The paper presents a deep learning-based solution for estimating knee flexion angle using image data. This involves training convolutional neural networks to predict the coordinates of key points in the knee joint. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of transfer learning and data augmentation techniques, which are common in machine learning research, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the potential for this technology to support rehabilitation, which could fall under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Additionally, the use of a 3D human-body model suggests that the paper may also be relevant to cs.RO (Robotics) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
